intro: Weihea sericea, commonly known as the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy, soft leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing on rocky slopes or in sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
